overview: This schema captures the essential, observable provisions of a Master Credit Agreement exhibit. It extracts the transacting parties and their roles, the type and amount of the credit facility, the interest rate benchmark and spread, the effective and maturity dates, and the governing law. Each field maps directly to verbatim text in the agreement. Repeating concepts (e.g., parties) are represented as arrays of objects. The schema omits generic EDGAR metadata and focuses solely on facts within the exhibit that analysts will query. It ensures consistent downstream quantitative analysis of credit terms across similar agreements.

fields.name: parties
fields.description: List of entities to the agreement with their contractual roles.
fields.rationale: Identifies each signatory and their role for counterparty analysis.

fields.name: facility_type
fields.description: The category of credit facility provided (e.g., revolving credit).
fields.rationale: Distinguishes among different financing structures and their terms.

fields.name: facility_amount
fields.description: The principal commitment amount of the credit facility as stated.
fields.rationale: Quantifies the maximum borrowing capacity under the agreement.

fields.name: interest_rate_benchmark
fields.description: The reference benchmark rate for calculating interest (e.g., SOFR).
fields.rationale: Determines the base index to which spreads are added for pricing.

fields.name: interest_rate_spread_bps
fields.description: The number of basis points added to the benchmark to arrive at the annual rate.
fields.rationale: Captures the margin over the benchmark, reflecting credit risk pricing.

fields.name: effective_date
fields.description: The date on which the agreement becomes operative.
fields.rationale: Marks the start of availability and accrual of obligations and interest.

fields.name: maturity_date
fields.description: The final date by which all obligations under the facility must be repaid.
fields.rationale: Defines the term length and end of the borrowing period.

fields.name: governing_law
fields.description: The jurisdiction whose laws govern the interpretation and enforcement of the agreement.
fields.rationale: Determines the legal framework and venue for dispute resolution.
